Name: CR_requirement_0
Specification: The system shall respond to applied pedal torque with resistance calculated from the base level of resistance, current gearing and applied torque to simulate pedal resistance during road riding.

Name: CRD_01
Specification: The Rider Application subsystem shall accept the Rider Weight from the Configuration app.

Name: CRD_02
Specification: The Rider Application shall use Ride Weight in computation of commanded pedal Resistance

Name: CRD_03
Specification: The Data Management Subsystem shall store Rider Configuration data including age, sex, weight, and height.

Name: CRD_04
Specification: The Pedal Assembly subsystem shall provide pedal cadence to the Rider Application subsystem.

Name: CRD_05
Specification: The Pedal Assembly subsystem shall provide rider power at the point of the pedal at least every 100 ms to the Rider Application Subsystem

Name: CRD_06
Specification: The Rider Application subsystem shall accept time-filter settings from the Trainer App from the set of 0 (instantaneous power), 1-second, 3-second, and 5-second).

Name: CRD_07
Specification: The Rider Application subsystem shall compute time-filtered power at least every 300 ms

Name: CRD_08
Specification: The Rider Application subsystem shall send the time-filtered power to the Training App via the Comms subsystem at least every 300ms.

Name: CRD_09
Specification: The Comms subssytem shall transmit ride data to the Training App at the direction of the Rider Application subsystem within 20ms of recept of the message.

Name: CRD_10
Specification: The Rider Application Subsystem shall send simulated road speed to the Training App via the Comms subsystem at least every 1000 ms.

Name: CRD_11
Specification: The Rider Application Subsystem shall verify the validaity of the gearing configuration received via the Comms subsystem from the Configuraiton App.

Name: CRD_12
Specification: The Data Management subsystem shall be able to store gearing configuration

Name: CRD_13
Specification: The System Configuration shall store the gearing configuration via the Data Management System

Name: CRD_14
Specification: The Rider Application susbsytem shall compute resistance commanded to the Motor Assembly subsystem.

Name: CRD_15
Specification: The Rider Applicatiion system shall store current gear

Name: CRD_16
Specification: The Data Management subsystem shall store all its data persistently so that it is retained acoss power resets.

Name: CRD_17
Specification: The Comms subsystem shall accept messages from the Trainer App

Name: CRD_18
Specification: The Comms subsystem shall accept messages from the Configuration App.

Name: CRD_19
Specification: The Comms subsystem shall accept set Incline from the Training App and send it to the Rider Application subsystem.

Name: CRD_20
Specification: The Rider Application subssytem shall cpmpute rioad speed

Name: CRD_21
Specification: The Incline Control subsystem will send commanded Incline.

Name: CRD_22
Specification: The Rider Interaction substance shall be able to set inlcude from -20 to +20 % grade in 1 % grade increments.

Name: CRD_23
Specification: The Incline Control subsystem will set the system inclination as commanded within the range of -20 to +20 % incline with a precision of +/- 1% incline.

Name: CRD_24
Specification: The Motor Assembly shall create resistance under command of the Rider Appklication subsystem in the ranfge ogf 0 to 2000W.

Name: CRD_25
Specification: The Rider Application shall cmpute simulated acceleration

Name: CRD_26
Specification: The Drive Train shall transmit power from the motor to the pedal assembly

Name: CRD_27
Specification: The Motor Assembly susystem shall change to commanded power output in < 100ms

Name: CRD_28
Specification: The Rider Application susbystem shall compute and command the motor to set power output at least every 100ms during a ride

Name: CRD_30
Specification: The Mechanical Frame shall be able to accept 2000W of rider power for an extended period without Rider noticable frame deformation

Name: CRD_31
Specification: The Rider shall be able to select from the available front gearing.

Name: CRD_32
Specification: The Rider shall be able to select from the available rear gearing.

Name: DID01
Specification: The Rider Interaction subsystem shall provide an UP and DOWN button  for shifting.

Name: DID02
Specification: The Main Computing Platform subsystem shall respond to an upshift by going to the next highest gear ratio permitted with the current gear configuration.

Name: DID03
Specification: The Main Computing Platform subsystem shall respond to a downshift upshift by going to the next lowest gear ratio permitted with the current gear configuration.

Name: DID04
Specification: The Main Computing Platform shall manage DI shifting, when enabled.

Name: DID05
Specification: The Main Computing Platform shall enter DI shifting mode when commanded by a message received via the Comm Subsystem from the Configuration App.

Name: DID06
Specification: The Comm subsystem shall receive shifting messages from the Configuration App and pass their data onto the Main Computng Platform for processing.

Name: DID07
Specification: The Main Computing platform shall enter Mechanical Shifting Mode when commanded by a message received via the Comm siubsystem from the Configuration App.

Name: DID08
Specification: The Rider Interaction subsystem shall provide both mechanical shifters and DI buttons for shifting which provide identical inputs to the Main Computing Platform.

Name: DID09
Specification: The Rider Interaction subsystem shall only have either the mechanical shifters or the DI buttons active a a time, as commanded by the Main Computing Platform.

Name: DID10
Specification: The Main Computing Platform shall store the shifting selection  across software and power resets and software updates.

Name: DID11
Specification: The Main Computing Platform shall initialize the Rider Interaction subsystem with shifting mode during startup.

Name: DID12
Specification: The Comms subsystem shall recieve and delegate to the Main Computing Platform, messages from the Cionfiguraiton App for gearing model selection.

Name: DIQoSReq01
Specification: In DI Mode, shifts shall be executed in less than 400 ms or 1/4 pedal stroke, whichever is longer in time.

Name: DIQosReq02
Specification: The DI shifting button shall perform reliably for at least 100,000 presses.

Name: DIQoSReq03
Specification: In DI Shifting mode, gear shifts may be taken regardless of current power load being applied to the gears, from 0W to the maximum load allowed.

Name: DIReg01
Specification: In DI Shifting mode, if the UP button is pressed and the system is already in the highest possible gear, then the system shall audibly beep and keep the current gearing.

Name: DIReg02
Specification: The system shall provide shifting with a DI Shifting mode that enables the DI shifting buttons and disables the shifting levers.

Name: DIReg03
Specification: In DI Shifting mode, the UP button shall shift into the next highest possible gearing from the selected gear set, as measured in gear inches.

Name: DIReg04
Specification: In DI Shifting mode, the UP button shall shift into the next highest possible gearing from the selected gear set, as measured in gear inches.

Name: DIReg05
Specification: In DI Shifting mode, if the DOWN  button is pressed and the system is already in the lowest possible gear, then the system shall audibly beep and keep the current gearing.

Name: DIReg06
Specification: In DI Shifting mode, when an upshift requires changing the chain ring, the system shall progress to the next largest gearing, as measured by gear inches.

Name: DIReg07
Specification: In DI Shifting mode, when a downshift requires changing the chain ring, the system shall progress to the next smallest gearing, as measured by gear inches.

Name: DIReq10
Specification: The system shall enter DI Shifting Mode by selecting that option in the Configuration App.

Name: DIReq11
Specification: Once DI Shifting mode is selected, this selection shall persist across resets, power resets, and software updates.

Name: DIReq12
Specification: Mechanical shifting shall be the default on initial start up or after a factory-settings reset.

Name: DIReq13
Specification: The system shall leave DI Shifting mode when the user selects the Mechanical Shifting option in the Configuration App.

Name: efarg01
Specification: The system shall notify the rider of the current number of chain rings and cassette rings on start up.

Name: efarg02
Specification: The system shall accept a rider command to enter a mode to configure the gearing.

Name: efarg03
Specification: The system shall accept a rider command to set up from 1 to 3 front chain rings, inclusive.

Name: efarg04
Specification: The default number of chain rings shall be 2.

Name: efarg05
Specification: The rider shall be able to decrement the cassette ring from a higher (smaller number of teeth) to the next lower (larger number of teeth) gear until the largest cassette ring is reached.

Name: efarg06
Specification: The system shall accept a rider command to set up from 10-12 cassette rings, inclusive.

Name: efarg07
Specification: The default number of cassette rings shall be 12.

Name: efarg08
Specification: The system shall accept a rider command to set any chain ring to have from 20 to 70 teeth.

Name: efarg09
Specification: The system shall accept a rider command to set up any cassette ring to have from 10 to 50.

Name: efarg10
Specification: The default number of teeth for 1 chain ring shall be 48.

Name: efarg11
Specification: The default number of teeth for 2 chain rings shall be 34 and 53.

Name: efarg12
Specification: The system shall inform the rider of the new gearing when the gear is changed.

Name: efarg13
Specification: The default number of teeth for 3 chain rings shall be 28, 40, and 56.

Name: efarg14
Specification: The system shall inform the training app of the new gearing when the gear is changed.

Name: efarg15
Specification: The default number of teeth for 10 cassette rings shall be 11, 12, 14, 16, 18, 20, 22, 25, 28, and 32.

Name: efarg16
Specification: The default number of teeth for 11 cassette rings shall be 11, 12, 13, 14, 15, 16, 17, 19, 21, 23, and 25.

Name: efarg17
Specification: The default number of teeth for 12 cassette rings shall be 11, 13, 15, 17, 19, 21, 24, 28, 32, 36, 42, and 50.

Name: efarg18
Specification: The rider shall be able to command the system to leave configuration mode.

Name: efarg19
Specification: The default starting gear shall be chain ring 1 and cassette ring 1 when starting a ride.

Name: efarg20
Specification: The rider shall be able to augment the front chain ring from a lower to the next higher gear until the largest chain ring is reached.

Name: efarg21
Specification: The rider shall be able to decrement the front chain ring from a higher to the next lower gear until the smallest chain ring is reached.

Name: efarg22
Specification: The rider shall be able to augment the cassette ring from a lower (larger number of teehth) to the next higher (smaller number of teeth) gear until the smallest cassette ring is reached.

Name: efarg23
Specification: The system shall send the current gearing to the training app when the current gearing changes changes.

Name: efarg24
Specification: The system shall respond to a rider-initiated increase in gear by applying the new level of gearing provided that it does not exceed the maximum gearing of the gearing configuration.

Name: efarg25
Specification: The system shall respond to a ride-initiated decrease in gear by applying the new level of gearing provided that it does not exceed the minimum gearing of the gearing configuration.

Name: efarg26
Specification: The system shall display the current selected gear.

Name: efarg27
Specification: The system shall default to the minimum gear during initialization.

Name: EFD01
Specification: The Main Computing Platform shall notify the Rider Interaction subsystem of the current simulated front and gear gear selection.

Name: EFD02
Specification: The Comm system shall receive commands to set up gearing from the Configuration App and delegate to the Main Computing Platform.

Name: EFD03
Specification: The Main Computing Platform shall process and store front and rear gearing configuration recevied via the Comm subsystem from the Configuration App.

Name: EFD04
Specification: The Rider Interaction Subsysten shall display the currently selected front and rear gear, as commanded by the Main Computing Platform.

Name: EFD05
Specification: The Rider shall be able to shift to the next highest or next lowest gear.

Name: EFD06
Specification: The Main Computing Platform shall allow up or down shifting until either the highest or lowest gear is reached.

Name: PowerReq01
Specification: The Electrical Power Delivery subsystem shall accept input power from 100 - 240V at 50-60Hz with a maximum current draw of 2.5 Amps.

Name: PowerReq02
Specification: The Electrical Power Delivery subsystem shall supply digital current to power computing devices.

Name: PowerReq03
Specification: The Rider Interaction subsystem shall provide a switch to power on and power off the system.

Name: PowerReq04
Specification: Upon receiving a power off messages from the Rider Interaction subsystem, tThe Main Computing Platform shall store system and rider configuration and then send a message to the Electrical Power Delivery subsystem to remove power.

Name: PowerReq05
Specification: The Electrical Power Delivery subsystem shall supply adequate power to create rider resistance to the Power Train subsystem.

Name: PowerReq06
Specification: The Electrical Power Delivery subsystem shall provide adequate power for chaning the system inclination to the Mechanical Frame subsystem.

Name: CR_requirement_11
Specification: The system shall accept road incline from the connected training app.

Name: CR_requirement_9
Specification: The system shall accept simulated incline from the connected training app throughout a training session.

Name: CR_requirement_14
Specification: The system shall compute and apply resistance to pedal movement based on simulated inertia, speed, acceleration and rider power input.

Name: CR_requirement_12
Specification: The system shall compute simulated drag based on computed rider inertia and simulated road incline.

Name: CR_requirement_13
Specification: The system shall compute simulated road speed based on computed inertia, includen, current simulated speed and acceleration, and rider-applied force to the pedal.

Name: CR_requirement_7
Specification: The system shall provide time-filtering of power, supporting 0, 1-second, 3-second, and 5-second power averaging, settable by the rider.

Name: CR_requirement_2
Specification: The system shall store the current gear persistently so that the last gear is retained across power cycles and resets.

Name: CR_requirement_6
Specification: The system shall measure force applied by the rider to the pedals.

Name: CR_requirement_3
Specification: The system shall monitor pedal position and speed.

Name: CR_requirement_4
Specification: The system shall compute pedal cadence.

Name: CR_requirement_24
Specification: The system shall update the physics model frequently enough to provide the rider a smooth and road-line experience with respect to resistance.

Name: CR_requirement_5
Specification: The system shall send pedal cadence to the associated training app, when connected.

Name: CR_requirement_8
Specification: The system shall send filtered power to the training app, if connected.

Name: CR_requirement_15
Specification: The system shall send computed speed and acceleration to the connected training app, if any.

Name: CR_requirement_10
Specification: The system shall store gear ratio from the gear setting.

Name: CR_requirement_23
Specification: The system shall update the training app with pedal cadence at least 1.0 seconds.

Name: CR_requirement_22
Specification: The system shall update the training app with rider filtered power output at least 0.5 seconds

Name: CR_requirement_21
Specification: The system shall update the training app with simulated bike speed at least 1.0 seconds

Name: CR_requirement_25
Specification: The system shall send current watts per kilogram to the training app for the current power output at least every 1.0 seconds.

Name: CR_requirement_1
Specification: The system shall store the rider weight for the computation of pedal resistance.
